column2: Jen Stamp (Jen.Stamp@tetratech.com) and Sean Sullivan (ssullivan@rhithron.com)

major taxonomic groups - Acari, Chironomidae, Coleoptera, Crustacea, Diptera, Ephemeroptera, Hemiptera, Leeches, Lepidoptera, Megaloptera, Misc. Phyla, Mollusca, Neuroptera, Odonata, Oligochaeta, Plecoptera, Polychaeta, Trichoptera
taxon name from the original source file
reason for the change (blank if no change)

original taxon name translated to a regional ID that harmonizes differences (such as syntax, changes in nomenclature, misspellings, etc.). Used for the thermal preference metric calculations. DNI (do not include - e.g., terrestrial, marine)
Operational Taxonomic Unit (OTU) for the ORWA statewide BCG calculation. Worms are collapsed to Oligochaeta. DNI (do not include - e.g., terrestrial, marine)
OTU for the ORWA statewide BCG calculation, with worms at finer level of resolution. DNI (do not include - e.g., terrestrial, marine)
Taxonomic Serial Number - a unique, persistent, non-intelligent identifier for a scientific name in the context of the Integrated Taxonomic Information System (ITIS).
taxonomic hierarchy based on the Taxon_orig field; the hierarchy in the final 'built' file is based on the final OTU/hierarchy in the Attributes table
